system.tooltip: Cantrips are the simplest and weakest of spells, and can be casted without expending Spell Slots. As a spellcaster, your class will give you a certain number of cantrips you can cast, and you may gain others through your background, feat, or other source. Whenever a rule or feature refers to 'spells', that includes cantrips unless otherwise indicated.

system.tooltip: Upcasting is when you cast a spell with a higher level spell slot than the level of the spell. For example, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-spells.Item.4LmfNXTDDG0fITnF]{Charm} at 2nd level using a 2nd level spell slot, even though the spell is a 1st level spell. Many spells become stronger when you upcast them, which is detailed at the bottom of the spell description.

system.tooltip:
Spells that aren't cantrips have a spell level of 1st to 9th level. The higher the level, the more powerful the spell. You gain more spell slots and the ability to cast higher level spells when you level up. Each spell you learn must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For example, when you reach level 3 as a wizard, you can learn two new spells of 1st or 2nd level, or one of each.

To cast a spell, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. Your class's progression table (eg. @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-class.Item.qM0tUqAZW3V8L4pF]{Wizard Progression Table}) shows how many spells and spell slots you have to cast your spells of 1st level and higher. Some characters and many monsters have special abilities that let them cast spells without using spell slots.

You regain all spell slots and uses of your spells when you finish a &reference[long rest].

pages.name: Casting Multiple Spells in a Turn

system.tooltip:
Spellcasters can only cast one spell of 1st level or higher in a turn. When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, you can still cast a cantrip in the same turn. The exception is spells that have a casting time of 1 reaction- those do not count towards your limit.

  • Allowed: Casting @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-spells.Item.gRspPs2vx18Jx5BQ]{Sacred Flame} (cantrip) as an action and @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-spells.Item.aPpgVMnTftBzPZwi]{Shield of Faith} (1st level) as a bonus action.

  • Allowed: Casting @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-spells.Item.D93gCdE5X0z3VUqZ]{Feather Fall} (1st level) as a reaction and @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-spells.Item.pbT9cw6nsjpmwrVZ]{Fireball} (3rd Level) as an action.

  • Not Allowed: Casting @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-spells.Item.pbT9cw6nsjpmwrVZ]{Fireball} (3rd level) as an action and then using a sorcerer's @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-class-features.Item.gbbKnue1XQGSKFzw]{Quickened Spell} to cast it again.

  • Not Allowed: Using a scroll or wand of @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-spells.Item.pbT9cw6nsjpmwrVZ]{Fireball} (3rd level) and then casting @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-spells.Item.HKiFSQzi9E2rgaLV]{Healing Word} (1st level).

  • Not Allowed: Readying the @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-spells.Item.HKiFSQzi9E2rgaLV]{Healing Word} (1st level) spell as a bonus action, then taking the attack action and using a paladin's @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-class-features.Item.u7aPgi0U1YedIg3K]{Divine Smite} (1st level).

system.tooltip: If a spell is cast on the same creature more than once, or two spells are cast on the same creature but both spells have the same effect, then you only apply the effects of the spell from the spellcaster with the higher &reference[abilityspells]{spell save DC} (if the DCs of both casters are the same, apply the most recent spell only). If the dominant spell ends, the lesser spell then reactivates. Thus, if a character is affected by two different @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-spells.Item.lul0V4xIEqxIhJaZ]{Haste} spells, they only gain the benefit once. At the GM's discretion, a creature may be affected by the same spell twice where that makes sense, such as with two separate @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-spells.Item.Fn71VAKQOXzIt89X]{Suggestion} spells.

system.tooltip:
You use your class's spellcasting ability whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your spellcasting ability modifier modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

Spell Save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your spellcasting ability modifier

Spell Attack Bonus = your proficiency bonus + your spellcasting ability modifier

For example, a @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-class.Item.qM0tUqAZW3V8L4pF]{wizard}'s spellcasting ability is &reference[intelligence]. A wizard with an intelligence of 16 and a proficiency bonus of 2 would have a spell save DC of 13 and a spell attack bonus of +5.

system.tooltip:
Spellcasters need to be able to see their target for most spells. If a spellcaster is &reference[blinded] or otherwise can't see their target, then the spellcaster does not have line of sight.

In general:

  • Area of effect spells (like @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-spells.Item.pbT9cw6nsjpmwrVZ]{Fireball}) must be centered on a space the caster can see. For line effects like @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-spells.Item.zQ7lBRzId8peTjor]{Wall of Fire}, the caster must be able to see either the center or one end of the line.

    • In the case of cone, cube, and line area of effects originating from the caster (like @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-spells.Item.mVhHk4YEzfICiaiz]{Lightning Bolt} or @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-spells.Item.NKvSCOg8Wivgexw6]{Thunderwave}), the caster does not need line of sight.

  • Spells that require the caster to make a spell attack (like @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-spells.Item.2Wh2etRL3SpfI86v]{Fire Bolt} or @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-spells.Item.xZu2pzKegvWyGnKo]{Acid Arrow}) do not require line of sight. However, if the caster cannot see the target, their attack has disadvantage, just like with a weapon attack.

  • A spellcaster must have line of sight to all targets of spells targeting specific creatures (like Mass @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-spells.Item.HKiFSQzi9E2rgaLV]{Healing Word} or @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-spells.Item.aSJ4pikzIYISiUNm]{Hellish Rebuke}).

  • A spell that activates as part of a weapon attack (such as a paladin's @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-class-features.Item.u7aPgi0U1YedIg3K]{Divine Smite}) does not require line of sight.

  • Targeting yourself, your space, or a creature you can touch does not require line of sight.

  • If you can't directly see a target, but know their location with &reference[Blindsight] or &reference[Tremorsense], you count as having line of sight to that creature.

  • If a spell requires &reference[concentration], you do not need to remain within line of sight to continue concentrating on the effect.

system.tooltip:
Sometimes obstacles, walls, or other forms of cover block or partially block spells.

  • A creature with &reference[totalcover]{full cover} against a spellcaster cannot be targeted by a spell. See &reference[cover]{cover} for the benefits of partial cover.

  • An area of effect expands from its point of origin (eg. the center of a radius or one end of a line). If the area of effect hits an obstacle, it does not expand past the obstacle. For example, a @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-spells.Item.zfFvSNcyrjbcDeEJ]{Cone of Cold} might be blocked by the wall of a building, allowing creatures on the other side of the wall to be unaffected.

  • A spellcaster has line of sight through a transparent surface, such as a glass window or a @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-spells.Item.KdHgTZaQPRQOaTrB]{Wall of Force} spell, but some spells also require a clear path to the target. Spells like @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-spells.Item.Mvx2Nzj5Nz6MjRVC]{Moonbeam} or @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-spells.Item.NpFvVJ2qYoRpDAw8]{Bless} which have an effect originating on the other side of the barrier can function, but spells like @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-spells.Item.pbT9cw6nsjpmwrVZ]{Fireball} or @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-spells.Item.dHrZ4B6DGvwhsBDR]{Rock Blast} specify in their description that the effect originates from the caster, so even a transparent barrier might block the effect, at GM discretion.

system.tooltip: Each spell has a casting time, which specifies whether the caster must use an action, a bonus action, a reaction, minutes, or even hours to cast the spell. If a spell is a ritual, it will list the ritual casting time as well.

text.content: Each spell has a casting time, which specifies whether the caster must use an action, a bonus action, a reaction, minutes, or even hours to cast the spell. If a spell is a ritual, it will list the ritual casting time as well.

system.tooltip: Most spells will specify the number of targets and whether it targets creatures, objects, allies specifically, or possibly just the self. Some spells instead mention an area of effect here, such as a 20 ft. cone. Typically a spell that can affect unwilling creatures requires the caster to make a successful attack roll or the target to make a failed saving throw. A willing target can voluntarily fail a strength, dexterity, wisdom, intelligence, or charisma saving throw.

system.tooltip: When a spellcasting uses a spell that requires concentration, they must actively sustain that spell while the spell is ongoing. The caster gains the &reference[Concentrating] condition. When the caster takes damage, they must succeed on a constitution saving throw with a DC of 10 or half the damage taken rounded down (whichever is higher). If the caster fails or casts another spell that requires concentration, the spell ends. Concentration also ends if the caster becomes incapacitated.

A &reference[silenced]{silenced} character cannot cast a spell that requires verbal components. Characters using sign language to cast must still make accompanying sounds for signed verbal components to function.

The spellcaster can end a spell early without using a reaction at any time, unless the spell's effect is permanent.

system.tooltip: Some spells can be cast as a ritual. When a spellcaster casts one of these spells, they can take longer, typically 1 minute total, to cast the spell at its lowest spell level without using a spell slot. Any character can cast a spell as a ritual unless the spell is contained in a scroll or magic item.

system.tooltip:
When you create an illusion with @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-spells.Item.VAn6kqpftI8yLkit]{Minor Illusion}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-spells.Item.4aj73yzrHMc6N16Y]{Silent Image}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-spells.Item.FSW8kCe0PDmuxXnz]{Major Image}, and some other spells or features you roll an illusion check.

  • Roll [[/r 1d20]] and add your &reference[abilityspells]{spellcasting ability modifier} and your proficiency bonus.

  • Any creature with a &reference[passive perception] (10 + perception skill) equal or lower than the illusion check total sees the illusion as being real.

  • The caster, as well as any creature that has higher passive perception than the illusion total or comes into physical contact with the illusion, disbelieves the illusion, and the illusion appears faint and translucent to them.

  • If one creature sees through the illusion and tells other creatures, the other creatures can attempt an &reference[investigation] or &reference[perception] check using the &reference[search] action with a DC equal to the illusionist's spell save DC or touch the illusion to disbelieve the illusion.

  • If one creature sees through the illusion and tells other creatures, the other creatures can attempt an &reference[investigation] or &reference[perception] check using the &reference[search] action with a DC equal to the illusionist's spell save DC or touch the illusion to disbelieve the illusion.
Each class that can cast spells functions a bit differently, but there are more commonalities than differences.

system.tooltip:
Each spellcaster is either a known caster or a prepared caster.

  • Known casters choose spells when they level up and can only cast those spells. These are spells they 'know'. Known casters can switch spells they don't want anymore when they level up. @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-class.Item.SmG14gsqWBtqmcjt]{Bards}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-subclass.Item.8H0DO72vcXDNC271]{Mystic Tricksters}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-class.Item.emEIZZAh0s8Ed62c]{Sorcerers}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-subclass.Item.4DG4RRJZU118miqm]{Spellswords}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-class.Item.whbTNYgkqWV8oGt3]{Warlocks}, and @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-class.Item.whbTNYgkqWV8oGt3]{Wizards} are known casters.

  • Prepared casters choose which spells they want when they finish a long rest. These are the spells they have 'prepared', but they can swap which spells they have prepared for any other spell on their class spell list. @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-class.Item.Z68Q5K5fejrVQZAy]{Clerics}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-class.Item.653LgVa3sG4ek6b5]{Druids}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-class.Item.t9qEzMyJh0kg5Djk]{Rangers}, and @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-class.Item.Zg89AoSarbFbVnPY]{Paladins} are prepared casters.

system.tooltip:
Spell scrolls and spell wants allow characters to cast spells that they don't know or have prepared.

Spell scrolls can be scribed by spellcasters proficient with @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.PSBsNmH0WWBmwTMY]{calligrapher's tools}. A spell scroll contains a single casting of a spell which can be used by the person who scribed the scroll or by someone else. Scrolls are one-use items.

When you cast a spell from a spell scroll:

  • You must be a spellcaster who can cast spells from a class that gives you spell slots.

  • It has its usual casting time, component costs, and counts towards your &reference[multiplespellsinaturn]{limit of one spell per turn}.

  • You do not expend a spell slot.

  • You must provide any material component with a gold cost greater than 1 gold, just like with spells you cast that aren't scrolls.

If the spell is on your class's spell list, or is a spell you can otherwise cast:

  • The spell is cast with no check, even if the spell is a higher level spell than you would normally be able to cast.

  • You use your &reference[abilityspells]{spellcasting ability}, &reference[abilityspells]{spellcasting attack bonus} or &reference[abilityspells]{spell save DC}.

  • The scroll's magic fades and the ink disintegrates.

If the spell is NOT on your class's spell list:

  • After spending the time required to cast the spell, you must succeed on an arcana* skill check with a DC equal to 10 + the spell's level (DC 10 for cantrips).

    • Success: the scroll is cast. The scroll's magic fades and the ink disintegrates.

    • Failure: the spell fails. The scroll is not destroyed, and you can try again.

  • Your &reference[abilityspells]{spellcasting ability}, &reference[abilityspells]{spellcasting attack bonus} is +5 and your &reference[abilityspells]{spell save DC} is 13 for this scroll..

*You may choose to instead make a &reference[religion] check for spells on the &reference[cleric] spell list or a &reference[nature] check for spells on the @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-class.Item.653LgVa3sG4ek6b5]{druid} spell list.

You can check if a spell is on a @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.vaLYevRxKe8mAvdE]{spell list} here.

system.tooltip:
Some spells count as curses, such as @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-spells.Item.5YfzPpLkF7a0VrIq]{Curse of Frailty} or @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-spells.Item.43Vyt2wzU0SISfYm]{Rend Vigor}.

  • When you curse a target, you can choose to have the curse's effect occur under only specific circumstances, such as cursing a target with a Curse of Frailty that only affects them when fighting &reference[dragon]{dragons}.

  • You can set a duration or a condition that would end the curse, but you are not required to.

  • As the caster, you can choose to end the curse at any time.

  • If the target is later affected by the @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-spells.Item.xT937OvSQSRfUoix]{Protection From Curses} spell, the curse is temporarily nullified. A curse cannot be removed with @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-spells.Item.oZwKW3I3yzrSdpLE]{Dispel Magic}. Curses can be removed with @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-spells.Item.piOfkIqVwkpV4Znb]{Break Enchantment}.
